disea brought on by thi but that the bodi be one thing can be 
destroy by the bad of food which is anoth and which doe not 
engend ani natur infect thi we shall absolut deni 

veri true 

and on the same principl unless some bodili evil can produc an evil 
of the soul we must not suppo that the soul which is one thing can 
be dissolv by ani mere extern evil which belong to anoth 

ye he said there is reason in that 

either then let u refut thi conclu or while it remain 
unrefut let u never say that fever or ani other disea or the 
knife put to the throat or even the cut up of the whole bodi into 
the minutest piec can destroy the soul until she herself is prove 
to becom more unholi or unright in consequ of these thing 
be done to the bodi but that the soul or anyth el if not 
destroy by an intern evil can be destroy by an extern one is 
not to be affirm by ani man 

and sure he repli no one will ever prove that the soul of men 
becom more unjust in consequ of death 

but if some one who would rather not admit the immort of the soul 
boldli deni thi and say that the die do realli becom more 
evil and unright then if the speaker is right i suppo that 
injust like disea must be assum to be fatal to the unjust and 
that those who take thi disord die by the natur inher power of 
destruct which evil ha and which kill them sooner or later but 
in quit anoth way from that in which at present the wick receiv 
death at the hand of other a the penalti of their deed 

nay he said in that case injust if fatal to the unjust will not

if it have the power will murder other keep the murder aliv aye

hou of death 

true i said if the inher natur vice or evil of the soul is unabl

ye that can hardli be

certainli

the soul i said be a is now proven immort must be the fairest 
of composit and cannot be compound of mani element 

certainli not

where then 

at her love of wisdom let u see whom she affect and what societi and

and thing of earth and rock which in wild varieti spring up around her 
becau she feed upon earth and is overgrown by the good thing of 
thi life a they are term then you would see her a she is and know

that we have now said enough 

true he repli 

and thu i said we have fulfil the condit of the argument we

what did i borrow 

the assumpt that the just man should appear unjust and the unjust 
just for you were of opinion that even if the true state of the case 
could not possibl escap the eye of god and men still thi admiss

then a the cau is decid i demand on behalf of justic that the

true 

and now you must allow me to repeat of the just the bless which you

speak he said there are few thing which i would more gladli hear 

well i said i will tell you a tale not one of the tale which 
odysseu tell to the hero alcin yet thi too is a tale of a hero 
er the son of armeniu a pamphylian by birth he wa slain in battl 
and ten day afterward when the bodi of the dead were taken up 
alreadi in a state of corrupt hi bodi wa found unaffect by 
decay and carri away home to be buri and on the twelfth day a he 
wa lie on the funer pile he return to life and told them what he 
had seen in the other world he said that when hi soul left the bodi 
he went on a journey with a great compani and that they came to a 
mysteri place at which there were two open in the earth they 
were near togeth and over against them were two other open in the 
heaven abov in the intermedi space there were judg seat who 
command the just after they had given judgment on them and had bound 
their sentenc in front of them to ascend by the heavenli way on the 
right hand and in like manner the unjust were bidden by them to descend 
by the lower way on the left hand these also bore the symbol of their 
deed but fasten on their back he drew near and they told him that 
he wa to be the messeng who would carri the report of the other world 
to men and they bade him hear and see all that wa to be heard and seen 
in that place then he beheld and saw on one side the soul depart at 
either open of heaven and earth when sentenc had been given on them 
and at the two other open other soul some ascend out of the 
earth dusti and worn with travel some descend out of heaven clean 
and bright and arriv ever and anon they seem to have come from a 
long journey and they went forth with glad into the meadow where 
they encamp a at a festiv and those who knew one anoth embrac 
and conver the soul which came from earth curiou enquir about 
the thing abov and the soul which came from heaven about the thing 
beneath and they told one anoth of what had happen by the way 
those from below weep and sorrow at the remembr of the thing 
which they had endur and seen in their journey beneath the earth 
now the journey last a thousand year while those from abov were 
describ heavenli delight and vision of inconceiv beauti the 
stori glaucon would take too long to tell but the sum wa thi he 
said that for everi wrong which they had done to ani one they suffer 
tenfold or onc in a hundr year such be reckon to be the 
length of man s life and the penalti be thu paid ten time in a 
thousand year if for exampl there were ani who had been the cau 
of mani death or had betray or enslav citi or armi or been 
guilti of ani other evil behaviour for each and all of their offenc 
they receiv punish ten time over and the reward of benef 
and justic and holi were in the same proport i need hardli 
repeat what he said concern young child die almost a soon 
a they were born of pieti and impieti to god and parent and of 
murder there were retribut other and greater far which he 
describ he mention that he wa present when one of the spirit 
ask anoth where is ardiaeu the great now thi ardiaeu live 
a thousand year befor the time of er he had been the tyrant of 
some citi of pamphylia and had murder hi age father and hi elder 
brother and wa said to have commit mani other abomin crime 
the answer of the other spirit wa he come not hither and will never 
come and thi said he wa one of the dread sight which we 
ourselv wit we were at the mouth of the cavern and have 
complet all our experi were about to reascend when of a sudden 
ardiaeu appear and sever other most of whom were tyrant and 
there were also besid the tyrant privat individu who had been 
great crimin they were just a they fanci about to return into 
the upper world but the mouth instead of admit them gave a roar 
whenev ani of these incur sinner or some one who had not been 
suffici punish tri to ascend and then wild men of fieri 
aspect who were stand by and heard the sound seiz and carri 
them off and ardiaeu and other they bound head and foot and hand and 
threw them down and flay them with scourg and drag them along 
the road at the side card them on thorn like wool and declar 
to the passer by what were their crime and that they were be taken 
away to be cast into hell and of all the mani terror which they had 
endur he said that there wa none like the terror which each of them 
felt at that moment lest they should hear the voic and when there wa 
silenc one by one they ascend with exceed joy these said er 
were the penalti and retribut and there were bless a great 

now when the spirit which were in the meadow had tarri seven day 
on the eighth they were oblig to proceed on their journey and on the 
fourth day after he said that they came to a place where they could 
see from abov a line of light straight a a column extend right 
through the whole heaven and through the earth in colour resembl the 
rainbow onli brighter and purer anoth day s journey brought them to 
the place and there in the midst of the light they saw the end of 
the chain of heaven let down from abov for thi light is the belt 
of heaven and hold togeth the circl of the univ like the 
under girder of a trirem from these end is extend the spindl of 
necess on which all the revolut turn the shaft and hook of thi 
spindl are made of steel and the whorl is made partli of steel and 
also partli of other materi now the whorl is in form like the whorl 
use on earth and the descript of it impli that there is one larg 
hollow whorl which is quit scoop out and into thi is fit anoth 
lesser one and anoth and anoth and four other make eight 
in all like vessel which fit into one anoth the whorl show their 
edg on the upper side and on their lower side all togeth form one 
continu whorl thi is pierc by the spindl which is driven home 
through the centr of the eighth the first and outermost whorl ha the 
rim broadest and the seven inner whorl are narrow in the follow 
proport the sixth is next to the first in size the fourth next 
to the sixth then come the eighth the seventh is fifth the fifth 
is sixth the third is seventh last and eighth come the second 
the largest or fix star is spangl and the seventh or sun is 
brightest the eighth or moon colour by the reflect light of the 
seventh the second and fifth saturn and mercuri are in colour like 
one anoth and yellow than the prece the third venu ha the 
whitest light the fourth mar is reddish the sixth jupit is in 
white second now the whole spindl ha the same motion but a the 
whole revolv in one direct the seven inner circl move slowli in 
the other and of these the swiftest is the eighth next in swift 
are the seventh sixth and fifth which move togeth third in 
swift appear to move accord to the law of thi rever motion 
the fourth the third appear fourth and the second fifth the spindl 
turn on the knee of necess and on the upper surfac of each circl 
is a siren who go round with them hymn a singl tone or note the 
eight togeth form one harmoni and round about at equal interv 
there is anoth band three in number each sit upon her throne 
these are the fate daughter of necess who are cloth in white 
robe and have chaplet upon their head lachesi and clotho 
and atropo who accompani with their voic the harmoni of the 
siren lachesi sing of the past clotho of the present atropo of 
the futur clotho from time to time assist with a touch of her right 
hand the revolut of the outer circl of the whorl or spindl and 
atropo with her left hand touch and guid the inner one and 
lachesi lay hold of either in turn first with one hand and then 
with the other 

when er and the spirit arriv their duti wa to go at onc to 
lachesi but first of all there came a prophet who arrang them in 
order then he took from the knee of lachesi lot and sampl of 
life and have mount a high pulpit spoke a follow hear the 
word of lachesi the daughter of necess mortal soul behold a new 
cycl of life and mortal your geniu will not be allot to you 
but you will choo your geniu and let him who draw the first lot 
have the first choic and the life which he choo shall be hi 
destini virtu is free and a a man honour or dishonour her he will 
have more or le of her the respon is with the chooser god 
is justifi when the interpret had thu spoken he scatter lot 
indiff among them all and each of them took up the lot which 
fell near him all but er himself he wa not allow and each a 
he took hi lot perceiv the number which he had obtain then the 
interpret place on the ground befor them the sampl of life and 
there were mani more life than the soul present and they were of all 
sort there were life of everi anim and of man in everi condit 
and there were tyranni among them some last out the tyrant s life 
other which broke off in the middl and came to an end in poverti and 
exil and beggari and there were life of famou men some who were 
famou for their form and beauti a well a for their strength and 
success in game or again for their birth and the qualiti of their 
ancestor and some who were the rever of famou for the opposit 
qualiti and of woman likewi there wa not howev ani definit 
charact in them becau the soul when choo a new life must of 
necess becom differ but there wa everi other qualiti and 
the all mingl with one anoth and also with element of wealth and 
poverti and disea and health and there were mean state also and 
here my dear glaucon is the suprem peril of our human state and 
therefor the utmost care should be taken let each one of u leav 
everi other kind of knowledg and seek and follow one thing onli if 
peradventur he may be abl to learn and may find some one who will make 
him abl to learn and discern between good and evil and so to choo 
alway and everywh the better life a he ha opportun he should 
consid the bear of all these thing which have been mention 
sever and collect upon virtu he should know what the effect 
of beauti is when combin with poverti or wealth in a particular soul 
and what are the good and evil consequ of nobl and humbl birth 
of privat and public station of strength and weak of clever 
and dull and of all the natur and acquir gift of the soul and 
the oper of them when conjoin he will then look at the natur of 
the soul and from the consid of all these qualiti he will be 
abl to determin which is the better and which is the wor and so 
he will choo give the name of evil to the life which will make hi 
soul more unjust and good to the life which will make hi soul more 
just all el he will disregard for we have seen and know that thi is 
the best choic both in life and after death a man must take with him 
into the world below an adamantin faith in truth and right that there 
too he may be undazzl by the desir of wealth or the other allur 
of evil lest come upon tyranni and similar villaini he do 
irremedi wrong to other and suffer yet wor himself but let him 
know how to choo the mean and avoid the extrem on either side a 
far a possibl not onli in thi life but in all that which is to come 
for thi is the way of happi 

and accord to the report of the messeng from the other world thi 
wa what the prophet said at the time even for the last comer if he 
choo wise and will live dilig there is appoint a happi and 
not undesir exist let not him who choo first be careless 
and let not the last despair and when he had spoken he who had the 
first choic came forward and in a moment chose the greatest tyranni 
hi mind have been darken by folli and sensual he had not 
thought out the whole matter befor he chose and did not at first 
sight perceiv that he wa fate among other evil to devour hi own 
child but when he had time to reflect and saw what wa in the lot 
he began to beat hi breast and lament over hi choic forget the 
proclam of the prophet for instead of throw the blame of hi 
misfortun on himself he accu chanc and the god and everyth 
rather than himself now he wa one of those who came from heaven and 
in a former life had dwelt in a well order state but hi virtu wa 
a matter of habit onli and he had no philosophi and it wa true of 
other who were similarli overtaken that the greater number of them 
came from heaven and therefor they had never been school by trial 
wherea the pilgrim who came from earth have themselv suffer and 
seen other suffer were not in a hurri to choo and owe to thi 
inexperi of their and also becau the lot wa a chanc mani of 
the soul exchang a good destini for an evil or an evil for a good 
for if a man had alway on hi arriv in thi world dedic himself 
from the first to sound philosophi and had been moder fortun 
in the number of the lot he might a the messeng report be happi 
here and also hi journey to anoth life and return to thi instead 
of be rough and underground would be smooth and heavenli most 
curiou he said wa the spectacl sad and laughabl and strang for 
the choic of the soul wa in most case base on their experi of 
a previou life there he saw the soul which had onc been orpheu 
choo the life of a swan out of enmiti to the race of woman hate 
to be born of a woman becau they had been hi murder he beheld 
also the soul of thamyra choo the life of a nighting bird on 
the other hand like the swan and other musician want to be men 
the soul which obtain the twentieth lot chose the life of a lion and 
thi wa the soul of ajax the son of telamon who would not be a man 
rememb the injust which wa done him in the judgment about the 
arm the next wa agamemnon who took the life of an eagl becau 
like ajax he hate human natur by reason of hi suffer about 
the middl came the lot of atalanta she see the great fame of 
an athlet wa unabl to resist the temptat and after her there 
follow the soul of epeu the son of panopeu pa into the natur 
of a woman cun in the art and far away among the last who chose 
the soul of the jester thersit wa put on the form of a monkey 
there came also the soul of odysseu have yet to make a choic and 
hi lot happen to be the last of them all now the recollect of 
former toil had disench him of ambit and he went about for 
a consid time in search of the life of a privat man who had no 
care he had some difficulti in find thi which wa lie about and 
had been neglect by everybodi el and when he saw it he said that 
he would have done the same had hi lot been first instead of last 
and that he wa delight to have it and not onli did men pa into 
anim but i must also mention that there were anim tame and wild 
who chang into one anoth and into correspond human natur the 
good into the gentl and the evil into the savag in all sort of 
combin 

all the soul had now chosen their life and they went in the order of 
their choic to lachesi who sent with them the geniu whom they had 
sever chosen to be the guardian of their life and the fulfil 
of the choic thi geniu led the soul first to clotho and drew 
them within the revolut of the spindl impel by her hand thu 
ratifi the destini of each and then when they were fasten to 
thi carri them to atropo who spun the thread and made them 
irrev whenc without turn round they pa beneath the 
throne of necess and when they had all pa they march on in a 
scorch heat to the plain of forget which wa a barren wast 
destitut of tree and verdur and then toward even they encamp 
by the river of unmind whose water no vessel can hold of thi 
they were all oblig to drink a certain quantiti and those who were 
not save by wisdom drank more than wa necessari and each one a he 
drank forgot all thing now after they had gone to rest about the 
middl of the night there wa a thunderstorm and earthquak and then 
in an instant they were driven upward in all manner of way to their 
birth like star shoot he himself wa hinder from drink the 
water but in what manner or by what mean he return to the bodi he 
could not say onli in the morn awak suddenli he found himself 
lie on the pyre 

and thu glaucon the tale ha been save and ha not perish and 
will save u if we are obedi to the word spoken and we shall pa 
safe over the river of forget and our soul will not be defil 
wherefor my counsel is that we hold fast ever to the heavenli way and 
follow after justic and virtu alway consid that the soul is 
immort and abl to endur everi sort of good and everi sort of evil 
thu shall we live dear to one anoth and to the god both while 
remain here and when like conqueror in the game who go round to 
gather gift we receiv our reward and it shall be well with u both 
in thi life and in the pilgrimag of a thousand year which we have 
been describ

peopl in all walk of life

gutenberg literari archiv foundat wa creat to provid a secur 
and perman futur for project gutenberg tm and futur gener

and how your effort and donat can help see section 3 and 4
